greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle T(n,k)= tau(k)*phi(n/k) if k|n, else T(n,k)=0.
comment: Tau is the number of divisors A000005, and phi the Euler totient A000010.
example: First few rows of the triangle are:
maple: A127527 := proc(n,k) if n mod k = 0 then numtheory[tau](k)*numtheory[phi](n/k) ; else 0; end if; end proc: # _R. J. Mathar_, Apr 11 2011
results.author: _Gary W. Adamson_, Jan 17 2007
ext: Definition clarified by _R. J. Mathar_, Apr 11 2011
